clinical_study.brief_title: Sit-to-stand Test in Cystic Fibrosis Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Sit-to-stand Test Use in Children and Adolescents With Cystic Fibrosis : Correlations With 6-Minute Walking Test, Quadriceps and Respiratory Muscle Strength and Health Related Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock:
Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a chronic hereditary respiratory disease. Exercise testing is part of CF patients regular assessment.
Cardio-Pulmonary Exercise Testing (CPET) is currently considered as the gold standard to assess physical capacities. However, simple field tests are emerging. These tests are easier to perform especially in a population of CF children and adolescents.
The 1minute Sit-To-Stand test have recently been evaluated in CF adults. This test correlates with maximal oxygen consumption during CPET.
The investigators hypothesized that this test also correlates with 6-Minute Walking distance (during a 6-min Walk Test), quadriceps strength, respiratory muscles strength and health-related quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and 6-Minute Walking Distance
primary_outcome.time_frame: This outcome will be measured after both tests realization up to 15 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between the results of these two submaximal exercise tests

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS test) and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure (MIP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: MIP will be measured after inclusion in the hour before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: MIP will be assessed using a microRPM Puma manometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS test) and Maximal Expiratory Pressure (MEP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: MEP will be measured after inclusion in the hour before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: MEP will be assessed using a MicroRPM Puma manometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and health-related quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: HRQoL testing will be carried out after inclusion in the hour before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: HRQoL will be measured by the Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and quadriceps strength.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Quadriceps strength will be assessed after inclusion in the hour before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: Quadriceps strength will be assessed by handheld dynamometry using a MicroFet II dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and forced vital capacity (FVC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Spirometric test will be carried out before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: FVC will be assessed with non invasive spirometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Spirometric test will be carried out in the last 3 months before field tests realization.
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 will be assessed with non invasive spirometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between number of repetitions (STS Test) and number of exacerbations / year.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Number of exacerbations / year will assess the number of exacerbations in the last year before inclusion and will be assessed during the initial survey in the hour before field test realization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in dyspnea and muscular fatigue.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: These outcomes will be assessed during both field tests. These tests will be separate by a 30 minutes rest period. Date will be collected at the end of each test up to 15 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: These outcomes will be assessed using Modified Borg Scale (0-10 points)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: These outcomes will be assessed during both field tests. These tests will be separate by a 30 minutes rest period. Date will be collected at the end of each test up to 15 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: These outcomes will be assessed using pulse oximetry.

arm_group.description: Children and adolescents will perform 2 STS tests. First one is used to eliminate learning effect. Number of repetitions will be noted at the end of the second test.
Children and adolescents will perform 2 6MWT tests. First one is used to eliminate learning effect. Number of repetitions will be noted at the end of the second test.

intervention.description: CF young patients will perform 2 STS tests. Number of repetitions, cardio-respiratory response and physiological adaptations during the second test will be monitored.
CF young patients will perform 2 6MWT tests. Number of repetitions, cardio-respiratory response and physiological adaptations during the second test will be monitored.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cystic Fibrosis
- Exacerbation-free last month before inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular, neurological or musculoskeletal contra-indications to exercise testing
- Other respiratory disease (kyphoscoliosis, asthma ...)
- Exacerbation
- Unability to carry out field tests
